host.title: IP Address / Hostname
host.description: AdGuard Home hostname, the default is localhost.

port.title: Port
port.description: AdGuard Home port, the default is 80.

name.title: Switch Name
name.description: A unique name for this switch.

clients.title: Client/@Tag List
clients.description: A comma-separated list of AdGuard clients or @tags this switch will apply to. (Leave empty to affect 'default' AGH settings.)

services.title: Service List
services.description: A comma-separated list of service names AdGuard will block for the configured clients when turned on. (Leave empty to enable/disable _all_ blocking.)

defaultState.title: Enabled By Default
defaultState.description: The 'natural' state of the switch should be considered 'active' or 'on' meaning AdGuard Home is active. Timed switches will reset to this state when timers expire.

homekitType.title: Homekit Switch Type
homekitType.description: The type of switch-like service that should be presented in HomeKit. 'Lock' has more states, and more scrutiny because it is a 'Security' accessory. 'Television' shows more informative state in a single tile so long as it is a single switch. (ie, Only 0-1 timers configured.)

bridged.title: Bridged
bridged.description: Create a bridged (vs unbridged) accessory. Bridged accessories setup easier, but unbridged accessories have better icon control. (Neither have 'Category' control.) Unbridged accessories with multiple timers do not get grouped.

forceState.title: Force Changes
forceState.description: Force consistent blocking state in AdGuard Home, even if it's current status does not match the 'on' or 'off' state of this switch.

autoResetTimes.title: Timers
autoResetTimes.description: A comma-separated list of timeouts in minutes to wait before restoring the default state of the switch. (Set to 0 for no timer; Use multiple timers to create multiple switches which are identical aside from the reset timer.)
